header.description: I've been crafting custom web solutions and sharing insights about freelance development since 2006. I'm passionate about designing web apps, from UI/UX concepts to solving real-life complex problems with code. Feel free to contact me!

paragraphs: I'm a **freelance full-stack developer** based in Paris, France, building web and mobile experiences since 2006. Over the years, I've had the chance to work with major companies as well as startups.

I love turning ideas into real, working things. Whether it's crafting a slick UI, architecting a complex backend, or solving tricky problems with code: I'm in. These days, I'm especially excited about **Next.js**, **React Native**, and exploring how AI is reshaping the way we build software.

When I'm not coding, I'm probably making electronic music with Ableton Live and way too many VSTs, reading AI research papers, or cuddling my cats. There's something about sound design that scratches the same creative itch as programming.
Got a project in mind? **Let's talk.**

outOfBurn.title: I'm currently working on my own project called **Out Of Burn**: a wellness coaching app for **web, iOS, and Android** designed to help people recover from and prevent burnout.

faq.title: Curious Questions?
faq.subtitle: Everything you wanted to know about my work

items.question: Why did you create this portfolio?
items.answer: This portfolio showcases my skills and vision as a **Full-Stack JavaScript and TypeScript developer**. My goal is to make technical concepts accessible to everyone, using a friendly and creative approach. Whether you're a developer, a startup founder, or even my grandma ‚Äî I want you to understand what I do and why I love doing it!

items.question: Have you always been a developer?
items.answer: Yes and no! After my initial studies in development, I worked for companies like **Orange France, Free, and Safran** in various roles. These experiences helped me grow both technically and interpersonally. Eventually, I decided to go independent, which motivated me to go back to school and sharpen my skills. For the past years, I've been a **full-time freelance developer**, and I couldn't be happier!

items.question: What does a typical day look like for you?
items.answer: My day usually starts with a cup of green tea ‚òï and catching up on the latest tech news. If I'm working with a team, there's often a quick **daily standup** to align on tasks. Then it's all about prioritizing ‚Äî thinking through problems, researching solutions, and of course, **coding**. I push my work to shared repos, review code, and iterate. Oh, and there's always time for cuddling my cats between commits!

items.question: What makes you different from other developers?
items.answer: A developer is like a **digital architect** who structures applications to deliver the best user experience. There are many programming languages out there, each with its own strengths. My specialty? **JavaScript & TypeScript**. As a **Full-Stack developer**, I handle both frontend and backend, plus databases. This means I can deliver **complete, end-to-end solutions** ‚Äî from sleek UIs to robust APIs.

items.question: Why do you have only one public GitHub repo?
items.answer: Great question! This portfolio is currently my only **public project** on GitHub. Most of my other work is either confidential or belongs to clients. That said, I'm always on the lookout for opportunities to contribute to **open-source projects** and expand my public portfolio. Stay tuned ‚Äî more is coming!
